title: Boris Johnson Brexit deal LIVE: Scottish court to decide whether PM can be jailed over no-deal
text:
The highest civil court in Scotland is preparing to hear arguments over whether Boris Johnson can be forced to extend Article 50 to avoid leaving the EU without a deal.

The so-called Benn Act, which passed last month, requires the Government to seek an extension if an agreement isn’t reached by Halloween, but opponents are suspicious the Prime Minister will try to thwart legislation to fulfil his vow to leave on October 31 “do or die”.

The hearing, which could decide that fines or even a prison sentence could be imposed, comes as the European Council said the EU is “open but not convinced” by new proposals for a Brexit deal.

Irish premier Leo Varadkar welcomed the new proposals, but said they “fall short in a number of aspects”.
